algorithm_technique: Use a sliding window of size k. Calculate the sum of the first window, then slide the window by subtracting the outgoing element and adding the incoming element.
problem_summary_simple: Find the contiguous subarray of length k with the highest average value.
problem_summary_technical: Apply a sliding window of fixed size k. Maintain the sum of the current window and update the maximum sum.
key_insights: This is a classic sliding window problem.
Efficiently updating the window sum avoids re-calculating the sum for each subarray.
The key is to maintain the sum of the current window and compare it with the maximum sum found so far.
